titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. James Troutt, James Summers, and Henry Purcell, Indictment
CWG6778

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Marshall Circuit Court
Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against
James Troutt
Henry Purcelle

The Grand Jury of Marshall county in the name and by the authority of the commonwealth of Kentucky accuse James Troutt James Summers and Henry Purcell of the crime of robbery Committed as follows (Viz) The said James Troutt James Summers and Henry Purcelle on the 26th day of June 1865 in the county aforesaid feloniously took and carried away one horse of the value of Seventy five dollars. The property of Daniel Cross from the possession and in presence of the said Daniel Cross and against his will by putting him in fear of some immediate injury to his person. Against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

W. W. Tice
Commonwealth Atty
1st J. D.

Information by
Daniel Cross
John McCoy
A copy Attest J H Riley clk
Bail is fixed at Five Hundred dollars for each Deft

A Copy Attest
J, H, Riley Clk

Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against } Robbery
James Troutt James Summers Henry Purcell

Filed on bench warrant issued to McCracken July 13, 1865
Test J. H. Riley C P M C C

A true bill
J. D. Dupriest
Foreman

A Copy of Attest
J. H. Riley clk
